title: Smith Family Papers
scopeAndContent: Personal and business papers of the Smith family covering correspondence; financial records; photographs and memorabilia. The collection documents daily life and business activities in Johannesburg during the mid-20th century.
archivalHistory: Donated by the Smith family in 2010. Materials were stored in the family home until donation.
accessConditions: Open for research. Some personal correspondence restricted until 2030.

title: Correspondence
scopeAndContent: Letters and postcards exchanged between John Smith and family members; business associates; and friends. Includes both incoming and outgoing correspondence arranged chronologically.
archivalHistory: Maintained by John Smith during his lifetime, then by his wife Mary until 2010.

title: Personal Letters 1920-1935
scopeAndContent: Letters to and from immediate family members including parents; siblings; and extended family. Topics include family news; health updates; and social events.
archivalHistory: Part of correspondence series maintained chronologically

title: Financial Records
scopeAndContent: Business accounts; invoices; receipts; and tax documents related to Smith Trading Company. Includes ledgers; bank statements; and annual financial summaries.
archivalHistory: Maintained by company accountant until business closure in 1958
accessConditions: Restricted. Permission required for access to detailed financial records.

title: Tax Returns 1940-1960
scopeAndContent: Annual tax returns and supporting documentation for Smith Trading Company. Includes correspondence with tax authorities.
